alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Henry and eastern Fulton Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Napoleon, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mcclure around 305 PM EDT. Liberty Center around 310 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Delta and Swanton. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 38 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
